channel.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
channel.description: Well I just got Virgin 50mb cable broadband and have been wondering if I should invest in a wireless N router. Is it noticabley faster than wireless G?

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:371267”]If you only use it to download/upload from internet, then you probably will only notice a difference in the range. I use it to transfer files between computers on my network, to watch movies from my server on my PS3 and such, so the speed really makes a difference.

The difference in speed can vary quite a bit depending on your setup, but G has a MAX speed of 54Mbit/s, and N has a MAX speed of 600Mbit/s. (note Mbit/s (Mega-bits per second) is NOT Mega-bytes per second, a Bit is 1/8th of a Byte)[/quote]I think that my router only has N on the 5GHz band then, considering I max at 54mbps.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:371267”]If you only use it to download/upload from internet, then you probably will only notice a difference in the range. I use it to transfer files between computers on my network, to watch movies from my server on my PS3 and such, so the speed really makes a difference.

The difference in speed can vary quite a bit depending on your setup, but G has a MAX speed of 54Mbit/s, and N has a MAX speed of 600Mbit/s. (note Mbit/s (Mega-bits per second) is NOT Mega-bytes per second, a Bit is 1/8th of a Byte)[/quote]

Yeah lol that’s what ISPs do to fool you into thinking is 50 Megbytes per second…

pure2ownage:

Virgin Media gives it for free with most packages? :o

Cool, will see when they install it

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:

Virgin Media gives it for free with most packages? :o

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you only use it to download/upload from internet, then you probably will only notice a difference in the range. I use it to transfer files between computers on my network, to watch movies from my server on my PS3 and such, so the speed really makes a difference.

The difference in speed can vary quite a bit depending on your setup, but G has a MAX speed of 54Mbit/s, and N has a MAX speed of 600Mbit/s. (note Mbit/s (Mega-bits per second) is NOT Mega-bytes per second, a Bit is 1/8th of a Byte)

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:9, topic:371267”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=467354.msg3418719#msg3418719 date=1291333096]
Not really, unless your internet and wireless band support the speeds. Wireless N is really just useful for staying at a higher data transfer rate at further ranges. When I was on G, I would usually go between 11 - 36mpbs, but with an N router and N adapter, I’m almost always at 54mpbs with a 4 bar connection. Trust me, its worth it
[/quote]

I have an average of 0.4mbps, would it do much for me haha?
And yeah I mean like 40kb/s most of the time, not 400.

I would kill for 54mbps, it took me 6 days to download my BF:BC2 patch, including overnight :([/quote]

I was getting 22mbps on a G router, you need to upgrade your upload and download to be able to get better speeds, it’s not the router.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

rip4d:

Not really, unless your internet and wireless band support the speeds. Wireless N is really just useful for staying at a higher data transfer rate at further ranges. When I was on G, I would usually go between 11 - 36mpbs, but with an N router and N adapter, I’m almost always at 54mpbs with a 4 bar connection. Trust me, its worth it

I have an average of 0.4mbps, would it do much for me haha?
And yeah I mean like 40kb/s most of the time, not 400.

I would kill for 54mbps, it took me 6 days to download my BF:BC2 patch, including overnight

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Not really, unless your internet and wireless band support the speeds. Wireless N is really just useful for staying at a higher data transfer rate at further ranges. When I was on G, I would usually go between 11 - 36mpbs, but with an N router and N adapter, I’m almost always at 54mpbs with a 4 bar connection. Trust me, its worth it

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:371267”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=467354.msg3418368#msg3418368 date=1291306958]
I upgraded from G to N and I noticed no difference, only a little better range, but that’s just me.
[/quote]

Do you have a N card in your computer?[/quote]

It appears not, I would’ve thought so for a laptop costing ~$1400 but hey.
Does it make an awful lot of difference? Like an approximate download speed percentage increase?

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

SilentCJ:

I upgraded from G to N and I noticed no difference, only a little better range, but that’s just me.

Do you have a N card in your computer?

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

N is very much noticeably faster. But it won’t be any faster unless your clients support N as well (like your laptop, etc). Also, N routers really aren’t that expensive any more, I’d recommend you get one that supports running DD-WRT on it, it makes an excellent router.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I think N is the best you can get for personal use?

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless N - Worth it?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Its a LOT better than G for sure. I have a Dual-Band Netgear router (5GHz and 2.4GHz at once) and even the 2.4GHz is incredibly fast. You may need a wireless N or N+ adapter, but its still great.

Read full topic
